page.title: 12Crichel Estate Farms
page.content:
WHITE FARM White Farm is the central farm for Crichel Estate it was called White Farm because in the reign of Edward VII all the buildings and animals were white. The farm manager since 1951 has been Mr Peter Crane. The farm in all is some 4000 acres.
Main Cereal Crops: in all some 2887.5 acres consisting of Winter wheat, varieties "Mission" "Rapier" and "Fenman", also Winter barley variety "Igri", Spring barley varieties "Kypa" "Atem" and "Triumph". The Winter crops are planted in September and October and the Spring crops are planted February to April. Other main crops are silage and kale totalling 1027 acres.
